content:
TITLE: Adding OSMdroid Dependency with Gradle
DESCRIPTION: Gradle configuration for including the OSMdroid library as a dependency in an Android project. Requires adding Maven Central repository and the implementation dependency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: groovy
CODE:
```
repositories {
        mavenCentral()
}

dependencies {
    implementation 'org.osmdroid:osmdroid-android:<VERSION>'
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Converting Shapefiles to OSMDroid Overlays
DESCRIPTION: Java code demonstrating how to convert a shapefile to OSMDroid overlays and add them to a map view. The converter handles associated metadata files automatically if present in the same directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/osmdroid-shape/readme.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
List<Overlay>  folder = ShapeConverter.convert(mMapView, new File(myshape));
mMapView.getOverlayManager().addAll(folder);
mMapView.invalidate();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using OSMdroid SNAPSHOT Versions with Gradle
DESCRIPTION: Gradle configuration for using the latest development snapshot of OSMdroid. Includes both Maven Central and OSS Sonatype repositories to access snapshot releases.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: groovy
CODE:
```
repositories {
    mavenCentral()
    maven{
        url  'https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/'
        name 'OSS-Sonatype'
    }
}
dependencies {
    implementation 'org.osmdroid:osmdroid-android:<VERSION>-SNAPSHOT:debug@aar'
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding OSMdroid Dependency with Maven
DESCRIPTION: Maven configuration for including the OSMdroid library as a dependency in an Android project. Specifies the group ID, artifact ID, version, and package type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<dependency>
  <groupId>org.osmdroid</groupId>
  <artifactId>osmdroid-android</artifactId>
  <version><VERSION></version>
  <type>aar</type>
</dependency>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding OSMDroid Shape Dependency in Gradle
DESCRIPTION: Gradle dependency configuration for including the OSMDroid shape file converter module in your project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/osmdroid-shape/readme.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: gradle
CODE:
```
compile project('org.osmdroid:osmdroid-shape:VERSION')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Tile Server with JAR File
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the tile server using the compiled JAR file with an optional port parameter (default is 80).
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/osmdroid-server-jdk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
java -jar target/osmdroid-server-jdk-<version>-jar-with-dependencies.jar (optional port, default 80)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Locally Built OSMdroid Version
DESCRIPTION: Gradle dependency configuration for using a locally built OSMdroid snapshot version in your Android project. Includes the debug AAR variant.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: groovy
CODE:
```
    implementation 'org.osmdroid:osmdroid-android:<VERSION>-SNAPSHOT:debug@aar'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Local Maven Repository for OSMdroid Development
DESCRIPTION: Gradle configuration to add the local Maven repository for testing locally built OSMdroid versions. This should be added to the root build.gradle file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: groovy
CODE:
```
allprojects {
    repositories {
            mavenCentral()
            mavenLocal()    //add this if it's missing
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Forcing Gradle to Update SNAPSHOT Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Gradle configuration to force updating snapshot dependencies on each build by setting the cache time to zero seconds. Useful when working with OSMdroid SNAPSHOT versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: groovy
CODE:
```
allprojects  {
  // forces all changing dependencies (i.e. SNAPSHOTs) to automagicially download
    configurations.all {
        resolutionStrategy {
            cacheChangingModulesFor 0, 'seconds'
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing OSM Map Tile Packager via Java Command Line
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to run the OSM Map Tile Packager JAR file with various parameters to specify the tile source, output file, zoom levels, and geographical bounds.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/OSMMapTilePackager/readme.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
java -jar osmdroid-packager-<VERSION>-jar-with-dependencies.jar -u url -t <MapSourceName> -d <outputfile.zip> -zmin <MIN ZOOM> -zmax <MAX ZOOM up to 22> -n <NORTH> -s <SOUTH> -e <EAST> -w <WEST> -nthreads <optional, number of current threads, default 2> -fa <optional file extension add on, not really needed>1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building OSMDroid Project Using Gradle
DESCRIPTION: Gradle command to build and install the OSMDroid project locally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/osmdroid-server-jdk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
gradlew install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Tile Server with Gradle
DESCRIPTION: Alternative command to run the tile server using Gradle with a port parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/osmdroid-server-jdk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
../gradlew run <port>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Editing Sources Configuration File
DESCRIPTION: Command to edit the sources.properties file to configure tile database sources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/osmdroid-server-jdk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
vi sources.properties
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning OSMDroid Repository in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Command to clone the OSMDroid repository from GitHub, which is needed to build the tile server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/osmdroid-server-jdk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading OpenStreetMap Mapnik Tiles for Austria
DESCRIPTION: This command downloads OpenStreetMap Mapnik tiles for Austria, specifying the tile URL, map source name, output file, maximum zoom level, and geographical bounds.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/OSMMapTilePackager/readme.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
java -jar ....jar -u http://b.tile.openstreetmap.org/%d/%d/%d.png -t Mapnik -d at_mapnik_13.zip -zmax 13 -n 49.03942 -s 46.40162 -e 17.14736 -w 9.44595
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading OpenStreetMap Mapnik Tiles for Various Regions
DESCRIPTION: These commands demonstrate how to download OpenStreetMap Mapnik tiles for different regions, including Sweden, Germany, BeNeLux, Utrecht, France, Paris, Czech Republic, Ireland, UK, London, Spain, Poland, Italy, Switzerland, Portugal, Lisbon, Porto, USA, Manhattan, Washington D.C., and San Francisco.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
-u http://b.tile.openstreetmap.org/%d/%d/%d.png -t Mapnik -d se_mapnik_12.zip -zmax 12 -n 69.05567 -s 55.18336 -e 24.31045 -w 11.17080
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
-u http://b.tile.openstreetmap.org/%d/%d/%d.png -t Mapnik -d de_mapnik_12.zip -zmax 12 -n 54.9174 -s 47.281101 -e 15.03805 -w 5.869443
```

LANGUAGE: bash

```

```

```

```
-u http://b.tile.openstreetmap.org/%d/%d/%d.png -t Mapnik -d fr_mapnik_12.zip -zmax 12 -n 51.091099 -s 41.366379 -e 9.543055 -w -4.790556

-u http://b.tile.openstreetmap.org/%d/%d/%d.png -t Mapnik -d cz_mapnik_13.zip -zmax 13 -n 51.08776 -s 48.54 -e 18.87222 -w 12.049

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Minimum Android Platform Level for OSMdroid
DESCRIPTION: XML configuration to specify the minimum Android platform level (API level 8 = Platform 2.2) required for the OSMdroid library.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<platform>8</platform>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: ProGuard Configuration for Android OpenStreetMapView App
DESCRIPTION: Complete ProGuard configuration file for osmdroid OpenStreetMapView project. It defines rules for optimization, class preservation, and warning suppression. The configuration maintains essential Android components while allowing ProGuard to optimize code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/proguard_openmap.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: ProGuard
CODE:
```
# for use with OpenStreetMapView project



# Note that if you want to enable optimization, you cannot just
# include optimization flags in your own project configuration file;
# instead you will need to point to the
# "proguard-android-optimize.txt" file instead of this one from your
# project.properties file.

-keepattributes *Annotation*
#-keep public class com.google.vending.licensing.ILicensingService
#-keep public class com.android.vending.licensing.ILicensingService

# For native methods, see http://proguard.sourceforge.net/manual/examples.html#native
-keepclasseswithmembernames class * {
	native <methods>;
}

# keep setters in Views so that animations can still work.
# see http://proguard.sourceforge.net/manual/examples.html#beans
-keepclassmembers public class * extends android.view.View {
   void set*(***);
   *** get*();
}

# We want to keep methods in Activity that could be used in the XML attribute onClick
-keepclassmembers class * extends android.app.Activity {
   public void *(android.view.View);
}

# For enumeration classes, see http://proguard.sourceforge.net/manual/examples.html#enumerations
-keepclassmembers enum * {
	public static **[] values();
	public static ** valueOf(java.lang.String);
}

-keep class * implements android.os.Parcelable {
  public static final android.os.Parcelable$Creator *;
}

-keepclassmembers class **.R$* {
	public static <fields>;
}

# The support library contains references to newer platform versions.
# Don't warn about those in case this app is linking against an older
# platform version.  We know about them, and they are safe.
-dontwarn android.support.**
# To enable ProGuard in your project, edit project.properties
# to define the proguard.config property as described in that file.
#
# Add project specific ProGuard rules here.
# By default, the flags in this file are appended to flags specified
# in ${sdk.dir}/tools/proguard/proguard-android.txt
# You can edit the include path and order by changing the ProGuard
# include property in project.properties.
#
# For more details, see
#   http://developer.android.com/guide/developing/tools/proguard.html

# Add any project specific keep options here:

# If your project uses WebView with JS, uncomment the following
# and specify the fully qualified class name to the JavaScript interface
# class:
#-keepclassmembers class fqcn.of.javascript.interface.for.webview {
#   public *;
#}

-optimizations !code/simplification/arithmetic,!code/simplification/cast,!field/*,!class/merging/*
-optimizationpasses 4
-allowaccessmodification
-dontpreverify

-dontoptimize

########## Uncomment this for debugging
-dontobfuscate

# CMD :: why would we not shrink the code??????????
#-dontshrink

-dontwarn org.mozilla.javascript.**
-dontwarn org.apache.**
-dontwarn org.junit.**
-dontwarn junit.**
-dontwarn org.acra.collector.**

-keep class jsqlite.** {*;}
#-keep class org.jgroups.** {*;}
-keep class android.database.** {*;}
-keep class android.support.** {*;}

########### Solve wierd problems
-keepattributes *Annotation*
-keepattributes Signature

########### Main activities
-keep public class * extends android.app.Activity
-keep public class * extends android.app.Application
-keep public class * extends android.app.Service
-keep public class * extends android.content.BroadcastReceiver

##### things that need to be inflated...
-keep public class * extends android.view.View {
	public <init>(android.content.Context);
	public <init>(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet);
	public <init>(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet, int);
	public void set*(...);
}

-keepclasseswithmembers class * {
	public <init>(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet);
}

-keepclasseswithmembers class * {
	public <init>(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet, int);
}

# For smooth scrolling viewpager workaround
-keepclasseswithmembers class android.support.v4.view.ViewPager {
    private android.widget.Scroller mScroller;
}

############### ACRA specifics
# we need line numbers in our stack traces otherwise they are pretty useless
-renamesourcefileattribute SourceFile
-keepattributes SourceFile,LineNumberTable

-keepattributes *Annotation*
-keep class org.acra.** {*;}


# The support library contains references to newer platform versions.
# Don't warn about those in case this app is linking against an older
# platform version.  We know about them, and they are safe.
-dontwarn android.support.**



-keep class android.app.Instrumentation.** {*;}
-keep class java.lang.management.** {*;}
-keep class android.support.** {*;}
-keep class android.content.** {*;}
-keep class com.squareup.** {*;}
-keep class org.junit.** {*;}
-keep class android.service.media.** {*;}
-keep class android.content.** {*;}
-keep class libcore.icu.** {*;}
-keep class junit.framework.** {*;}
-keep class junit.framework.** {*;}
-dontwarn android.support.test.espresso.web.bridge.JavaScriptBridge

# android instrumentation test cases
-ignorewarnings

-keepattributes *Annotation*

-dontnote junit.framework.**
-dontnote junit.runner.**
-dontwarn android.test.**
-dontwarn org.junit.**
-dontwarn org.hamcrest.**
-dontwarn com.squareup.javawriter.JavaWriter
-dontwarn org.mockito.**

#-keep class org.junit.** {*;}
#-keep class com.android.support.** {*;}
#-keep class org.hamcrest.** {*;}
#-keep class org.ccil.** {*;}
#-keep class junit.** {*;}
#-dontwarn java.lang.management.**
#-dontwarn com.vladium.emma.**
#-keep class  org.easymock.** {*;}
#-keep class  android.test.** {*;}
#-keep class  sun.misc.** {*;}
#-keep class javax.lang.model.element.** {*;}
#-keep class java.beans.** {*;}


# https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/issues/633 SDK version 26
-dontwarn org.osmdroid.tileprovider.modules.NetworkAvailabliltyCheck
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring ProGuard Rules for osmdroid-android Library
DESCRIPTION: This ProGuard configuration file specifies rules for keeping classes and methods required by the osmdroid-android library. It includes rules for Android components, views, enumerations, and specific osmdroid classes to ensure proper functionality after obfuscation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/proguard_osm_min.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: ProGuard
CODE:
```
# keep setters in Views so that animations can still work.
# see http://proguard.sourceforge.net/manual/examples.html#beans
-keepclassmembers public class * extends android.view.View {
   void set*(***);
   *** get*();
}

# For enumeration classes, see http://proguard.sourceforge.net/manual/examples.html#enumerations
-keepclassmembers enum * {
	public static **[] values();
	public static ** valueOf(java.lang.String);
}

-keepclassmembers class **.R$* {
	public static <fields>;
}
# The support library contains references to newer platform versions.
# Don't warn about those in case this app is linking against an older
# platform version.  We know about them, and they are safe.
-dontwarn android.support.**


-keep class android.database.** {*;}
-keep class android.support.** {*;}
-keep public class * extends android.app.Activity
-keep public class * extends android.app.Application
-keep public class * extends android.app.Service
-keep public class * extends android.content.BroadcastReceiver

##### things that need to be inflated...
-keep public class * extends android.view.View {
	public <init>(android.content.Context);
	public <init>(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet);
	public <init>(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet, int);
	public void set*(...);
}

-keep class microsoft.mappoint.** {*;}

-keep class org.metalev.multitouch.controller.** {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.api.IGeoPoint {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.api.IMapController {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.api.IMapView {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.api.IProjection {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.events.** {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.tileprovider.constants.** {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.tileprovider.modules.** {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.tileprovider.tilesource.FileBasedTileSource {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.tileprovider.tilesource.OnlineTileSourceBase {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.tileprovider.tilesource.QuadTreeTileSource {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.tileprovider.tilesource.TileSourceFactory {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.tileprovider.tilesource.XYTileSource {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.tileprovider.util.Counters {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.tileprovider.util.ManifestUtil {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.tileprovider.util.SimpleInvalidationHandler {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.tileprovider.util.SimpleRegisterReceiver {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.tileprovider.util.StreamUtils {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.tileprovider.* {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.util.** {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.views.* {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.views.utils.** {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.views.overlay.gestures.** {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.views.overlay.* {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.views.overlay.infowindow* {*;}

-keep class org.osmdroid.* {*;}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Preserving osmdroid and Related Libraries in Proguard
DESCRIPTION: Keeps all classes from Microsoft MapPoint, osmdroid, and the multitouch controller library. This ensures that the mapping functionality works correctly after Proguard obfuscation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/proguard_osm.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: proguard
CODE:
```
-keep class microsoft.mappoint.** {*;}
-keep class org.osmdroid.** {*;}
-keep class org.metalev.multitouch.controller.** {*;}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Preserving View Setters and Getters for Animation Support in Proguard
DESCRIPTION: Keeps setters and getters in View classes to ensure animations continue to work when using Proguard. This rule follows the recommendation from the Proguard manual for preserving JavaBeans patterns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/proguard_osm.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: proguard
CODE:
```
-keepclassmembers public class * extends android.view.View {
   void set*(***); 
   *** get*();
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Preserving Core Android Framework Classes in Proguard
DESCRIPTION: Keeps essential Android framework classes intact, including database APIs, support libraries, and core components like Activities, Services, and BroadcastReceivers. This ensures the Android application fundamentals continue to work properly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/proguard_osm.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: proguard
CODE:
```
-keep class android.database.** {*;}
-keep class android.support.** {*;}
-keep public class * extends android.app.Activity
-keep public class * extends android.app.Application
-keep public class * extends android.app.Service
-keep public class * extends android.content.BroadcastReceiver
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Preserving Enumeration Classes in Proguard
DESCRIPTION: Maintains the values() and valueOf() methods on all enum classes, which are required for proper enum functionality. This follows the standard Proguard pattern for handling enumerations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/proguard_osm.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: proguard
CODE:
```
-keepclassmembers enum * {
	public static **[] values();
	public static ** valueOf(java.lang.String);
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Preserving View Classes for Inflation in Proguard
DESCRIPTION: Ensures that View subclasses and their constructors remain available for XML layout inflation. Also preserves setter methods which are often used by the inflation process to configure views based on XML attributes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/proguard_osm.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: proguard
CODE:
```
-keep public class * extends android.view.View {
	public <init>(android.content.Context);
	public <init>(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet);
	public <init>(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet, int);
	public void set*(...);
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Preserving Android Resource References in Proguard
DESCRIPTION: Keeps the fields in R classes that represent Android resources. This prevents Proguard from removing or renaming these references, which would break resource access at runtime.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/proguard_osm.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: proguard
CODE:
```
-keepclassmembers class **.R$* {
	public static <fields>;
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Suppressing Network Availability Check Warning in Proguard
DESCRIPTION: Prevents warnings about the NetworkAvailabilityCheck class when using Android SDK version 26 or higher. This addresses a specific issue documented in the osmdroid GitHub repository (issue #633).
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/proguard_osm.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: proguard
CODE:
```
-dontwarn org.osmdroid.tileprovider.modules.NetworkAvailabliltyCheck
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Suppressing Support Library Warnings in Proguard
DESCRIPTION: Prevents Proguard from warning about references to newer platform versions in the Android support library. These references are known and safe to ignore during obfuscation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/proguard_osm.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: proguard
CODE:
```
-dontwarn android.support.**
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git Branch Naming Convention for osmdroid
DESCRIPTION: Guidelines for naming git branches when contributing to osmdroid. Bug fix branches should be named 'bug/#(issueNumber)', while feature branches should be named 'feature/#issueNumber)'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
 * Bugs: use `bug/#(issueNumber)`
 * Features: use `feature/#issueNumber)`
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GitHub Issue Template Markdown Structure
DESCRIPTION: Markdown template for creating standardized GitHub issues. Includes checkboxes for issue type categorization and sections for describing the problem and environment details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid/blob/master/ISSUE_TEMPLATE.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
[ ] Question
[ ] Bug
[ ] Improvement
[ ] Build system related
[ ] Performance
[ ] Documentation

## Description and/or steps/code to reproduce the problem



## Environment

### If it's a bug, version(s) of android this affects:

All

### Version of osmdroid the issue relates to:

6.1.2
```
